de.must.appletserver
Class SessionStd

java.lang.Object
  de.must.appletserver.SessionStd

public abstract class SessionStd
extends java.lang.Object

Image of the session with its dialog stack. Each dialog is represented by an Remotable. When the session is reused, the current Remotable is asked to check the request; it will induce among others stack movements to previous or new dialog steps. Remotable objects are created as singletons and are kept until the stack place is used by another object.

setUseSeperateConnectionsForEachSession

public static void setUseSeperateConnectionsForEachSession(boolean newSeparateConnections)
Determines whether each session should use its own database connection or not. Should be set to true, if commit / rollback is to be used.

Parameters:
separateConnections - whether each session should use its own database connection or not

isOld

public boolean isOld()
Returns true if this session is old. Why do we check this? We do not kill a one and only session even if it seems to be unused. But MySQL loves to renew connections once a day. Therefore, an old session might have open tables with connection no longer valid.

Returns:
true if this session is old

destroy

public void destroy()
Destroy this object in order to free resources and weak references more early than garbage collector.

free

protected void free()
Frees (releases) references caused by this frame, particularly static register entries. To be called via destroy() to prevent multiple call. Override it to do additional releases and don't forget to call super.free() at the end.

See Also:
destroy()
